title: 'Mummy is very bad, got pappa killed': 9-year old's statement implicates mother's lover
content: In Alwar's Kherli, a nine-year-old boy witnessed his father's murder, allegedly orchestrated by his mother's lover and accomplices. The child reported that his mother, Anita, stood by as Kashiram Prajapat smothered Veeru Jatav. Anita and Kashiram, who had an affair, plotted the murder. Kashiram hired four men for Rs 2 lakh. Police arrested Anita, while three accused remain at large.

title: IND vs ENG: England name playing XI for first Test vs India; Woakes returns
content: England have revealed their playing XI for the first Test against India at Headingley, marking the start of the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy and the new World Test Championship cycle. Chris Woakes returns, and Brydon Carse makes his home Test debut.

title: Elon Musk warns of ‘America bankruptcy’; says all tax revenue will go to paying…
content: Elon Musk has cautioned about the US economy, suggesting potential bankruptcy if the national debt crisis isn't addressed. He highlighted that a significant portion of tax revenue is allocated to interest payments on the $37 trillion national debt. Musk's concerns echo previous warnings about the escalating debt and its implications for the nation's financial stability.

title: Iran ‘will never surrender’: Khamenei warns US of 'irreparable damage' if it intervenes
content: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, Iran's Ayatollah Khamenei warned the US against intervention in the ongoing conflict with Israel, threatening “irreparable damage.” This follows a fierce aerial war and inflammatory remarks by US President Trump. Iran claimed to have launched hypersonic missiles at Israel, marking a regional first.

title: Blow to BCCI: Bombay HC backs Rs 538 cr payout to Kochi Tuskers in arbitration case
content: The Bombay High Court has upheld arbitral awards exceeding Rs 538 crore in favour of the defunct Kochi Tuskers IPL franchise, dismissing BCCI's challenge. Justice Chagla emphasised the limited scope of court intervention in arbitration matters. Kochi Tuskers had played the 2011 season of the IPL before being terminated a year later.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos-Sanchez wedding: Venice Mayor says 'I am ashamed'
content: Jeff Bezos's upcoming Venice wedding has sparked controversy, dividing residents. While city officials, like Mayor Luigi Brugnaro, welcome the event for its economic benefits and visibility, some locals protest, expressing resentment towards the mega-wedding. The "No Space for Bezos" collective voiced their opposition, highlighting the city's struggle to balance its historical identity with modern tourism.

title: Top banks cut savings account rates: SBI drops to 2.5%, HDFC and ICICI now at 2.75%
content: Savings account holders will earn less. State Bank of India, HDFC Bank, and ICICI Bank have reduced interest rates. This follows the Reserve Bank of India's repo rate cut. Other banks like Bank of Baroda and Federal Bank have also revised rates. The changes align deposit returns with the easing interest rate cycle.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant confirms India's batting order; sheds light on No. 4 & No. 5 spots
content: Rishabh Pant confirmed Shubman Gill will bat at No.4 in the first Test against England, filling Virat Kohli's spot, while Pant remains at No.5. This reshuffling follows the retirements of Rohit Sharma and Kohli, marking a significant change in India's batting order. The No.3 position is yet to be decided.

title: Intel layoffs: 10,000+ factory workers to be laid off; Why they won’t be getting any severance
content: Intel is planning significant job cuts in its foundry division. The layoffs will affect thousands of employees globally. This decision is part of a larger restructuring effort led by CEO Lip-Bu Tan. The company aims to streamline operations and reduce costs. Intel has faced financial challenges and increased competition. Previous job cuts have already reduced the workforce.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Bunker buster, nuclear breakout time - Key words & phrases explained
content: Amidst escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, a glossary of critical military, nuclear, and diplomatic terms becomes essential. These definitions clarify complex concepts like uranium enrichment, air dominance, and proxy wars, highlighting the strategic depth and potential red lines that could trigger further conflict. Understanding these terms is crucial for navigating the intricacies of this volatile situation.

title: Pawar vs Pawar, again: Sharad-Ajit go head-to-head in Baramati
content: A power struggle unfolds in Baramati. Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar's factions clash in the Malegaon Cooperative Sugar Mill election. Ajit Pawar's panel faces competition from NCP(SP)'s newly formed group. Sharad Pawar urges voters to resist inducements. He regrets the split but accepts the democratic contest. The election on June 22 will determine control of the 21-member board.

title: IND vs ENG: Focus on openers, over-reliance on Bumrah, India's strengths and weaknesses
content: Swing has always proven to be India’s nemesis. The old adage of Test cricket, “give the first hour to bowlers and dominate the rest of the day,” doesn’t work when you are playing in England. But the question is: will Shubman Gill-led India be able to do it? TimesofIndia.com examines the strengths and weaknesses of the Indian team ahead of the first Test at Headingley.

title: 'Islamic Republic has reached its end': Exiled royal urges uprising in Iran
content: Reza Pahlavi, the exiled Iranian prince, has passionately called upon Iran's military, police, and state employees to join a nationwide uprising against the current Islamic Republic, asserting that its collapse is imminent. His appeal follows Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's strong endorsement of regime change in Iran, highlighting widespread dissent and suggesting the regime's days are numbered.

title: ICC rankings: Proteas heroes rise after WTC final glory; Indian stars hold ground
content: South Africa's historic World Test Championship victory has propelled their players up the ICC rankings. Aiden Markram's stellar performance earned him significant gains, while Kagiso Rabada remains a strong contender in bowling. Australia's Mitchell Starc also made notable progress. Among Indian players, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rishabh Pant hold their positions in the batting rankings, with Ravindra Jadeja leading the all-rounders.

title: Teen detainee killed in fight over bath space at juvenile home in Delhi's Majnu Ka Tila
content: A teenager was killed at a juvenile home in Delhi. The incident occurred after a fight over bathroom access. The victim was in custody for attempted murder. Police have registered a case of murder. They are investigating the ages of those involved. A judicial magistrate is conducting an inquiry. The body is at Hindu Rao Hospital for post-mortem.

title: Meet Elon Musk’s droneship which catches falling rockets, not hearts
content: SpaceX's autonomous drone ship, "Of Course I Still Love You," isn't a love song but a tribute to Iain M. Banks' sci-fi novels. This floating landing pad recovers Falcon 9 boosters, crucial for SpaceX's reusable rocket program. Paired with its sibling, "Just Read the Instructions," it transforms science fiction into reality, enabling cost-effective space travel.

title: Watch: Indian tourists do garba atop Burj Khalifa
content: A video showing Indian tourists performing Garba dance inside Dubai's Burj Khalifa has sparked a social media debate. The tourists danced to the Gujarati song 'Chogada,' leading to mixed reactions. While some appreciated the cultural display, others criticized the behavior in such a prestigious landmark.

title: Kedarnath trek horror: 2 dead as landslide strikes Junglechatti
content: A devastating landslide struck the Kedarnath trek route near Junglechatti ghat, resulting in the immediate deaths of two people and injuries to three others. The victims, including pilgrims and palanquin operators, were hit by falling boulders and knocked into a gorge.

title: ‘Suspicious marks found near private parts’: Autopsy report on influencer Kamal Kaur
content: Social media influencer Kachan Tiwari, known as Kamal Kaur Bhabhi, was found murdered in Bathinda. The autopsy reveals she was strangled, with suspicious marks on her thighs, though no sexual assault evidence was found. Amritpal Singh Mehron, accused of luring her to Bathinda, is a suspect, and a search is underway for him and another accomplice.

title: Honeymoon murder: How Sonam hid in 'secret' Indore flat; broke phones, dumped SIMs
content: A Shillong police team investigated an Indore flat where Sonam Raghuvanshi allegedly stayed after her husband's murder in Meghalaya. The search aimed to verify information from five suspects and gather evidence. Sonam, who disappeared after the May 23rd murder, reportedly fled to Indore around May 25-27, where her lover had arranged accommodation for her.

title: IND vs ENG: When was the first time ‘Indian’ cricket team crossed the Atlantic?
content: In the summer of 1911, an Indian cricket team, led by the young Maharaja Bhupinder Singh and featuring the remarkable Palwankar Baloo, embarked on their first tour of England. Despite facing seasoned English players and challenging conditions, the team, a diverse mix of Parsis, Hindus, Muslims, and Sikhs, managed to secure six wins in twenty-three first-class matches.

title: Canada's BC premier seeks terror tag for Lawrence Bishnoi gang
content: British Columbia's Premier David Eby is set to request Prime Minister Mark Carney to designate the Lawrence Bishnoi gang as a terrorist organization, citing links to extortion and crimes against the South Asian community. This demand comes amid PM Modi's visit to Canada, where he met with Carney to discuss strengthening ties and addressing transnational issues like terrorism.

title: IND v ENG: 'Rohit won't be missed as much as Virat'; Boycott urges hosts to use 'brain'
content: Geoffrey Boycott believes Virat Kohli's Test retirement is a bigger blow to India than Rohit Sharma's, citing Kohli's consistent performance and talismanic presence. Boycott urges England to temper their "Bazball" approach, emphasizing the importance of winning over entertaining, especially against a transitioning Indian team. He cautions England against overconfidence despite their recent win.

title: FASTag annual pass: How to purchase, validity, cost, trip limit & more - Top 15 FAQs answered
content: Starting August 15th, 2025, FASTag users can purchase an Annual Pass for ₹3,000, allowing unlimited passage for private cars, jeeps, and vans on designated National Highways and Expressways. The pass is valid for one year or 200 trips, whichever is earlier, and is available through the Rajmargyatra app or NHAI website. We answer the key FAQs:

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop ‘The Great One’
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: Champions SA return home: Thousands welcome WTC-winning Proteas - Watch
content: South Africa's cricket team received a hero's welcome in Johannesburg after their World Test Championship victory, their first major ICC trophy since 1998. Aiden Markram's century and Kagiso Rabada's nine wickets were crucial in the win against Australia. Looking forward, a new-look Proteas squad, including uncapped players, will face Zimbabwe in a two-Test series.

title: 'Escaped bombs, but now I’m stuck at border': Indian tourist trapped in war-hit Iran
content: Falguni Dey, a professor from Kolkata, is stuck at the Iran-Azerbaijan border. He escaped Tehran after airstrikes, hoping to reach Baku. Azerbaijan requires a special migration code, delaying his journey. Dey is facing emotional and financial strain. Indian officials are assisting him. He is considering an alternate route via Armenia. Strangers and officials are providing support to him.

title: Is Israel running out of missiles? Report claims defence system nearing breaking point
content: Amidst escalating conflict, a report indicates Israel's Arrow missile interceptor stock may be dwindling, prompting US support with additional defense systems. Israel has launched attacks on Tehran, targeting military production sites, while intercepting drones launched from Iran. The crisis intensifies with threats from Iran's leader and potential US involvement, impacting civil aviation and regional stability.

title: FASTag-based annual pass announced! Eligibility, validity and more details
content: Starting August 15, 2025, a ₹3,000 FASTag-based Annual Pass will be available for private vehicles like cars, jeeps, and vans. Valid for one year or 200 trips, this pass streamlines toll payments on National Highways across India.

title: ‘She’s his secret weapon’: Taylor Swift could fuel Chiefs' next Super Bowl win
content: Pat McAfee suggests Travis Kelce's relationship with Taylor Swift could be fueling his performance, potentially boosting the Kansas City Chiefs' chances for another Super Bowl run. McAfee believes Swift's influence extends beyond media attention, acting as a motivational force for Kelce to elevate his game. This connection could sharpen the team's focus and unity, making them even more formidable contenders.

title: Mysuru mishap: Many students injured as school van overturns; admitted to hospital
content: A school van accident near Habbanakuppe village in Mysuru injured eleven students on Wednesday. The van, carrying twelve students from MR Noble English Medium school, overturned after its axle reportedly broke. All injured students were rushed to Cheluvamba Hospital; most are stable, though five underwent CT scans. The driver sustained a forehead injury, and a student received stitches.

title: Bigg Boss 17’s Mannara Chopra breaks down in tears at her father’s funeral
content: Mannara Chopra is mourning the loss of her father, Advocate Raman Rai Handa, who passed away on June 16, 2025, in Mumbai. The actress, along with her sister Mitali and mother, performed the last rites at the crematorium. Mannara shared the news on Instagram, remembering her father as a pillar of strength.

title: Who was Luis Guevara? Orioles' young star dies in tragic accident at 19
content: Orioles' rising baseball player, Luis Guevara, tragically died in a jet ski accident in Florida at the young age of 19. Guevara, an infielder from Venezuela, showed great promise in the minor leagues, with a .281 batting average and a .420 on-base percentage. The Orioles organization and his teammates are mourning the loss of a kind, humble, and hardworking player.

title: EXCLUSIVE | IND vs ENG: 'Gambhir, not Gill, will be in the spotlight'
content: TimesofIndia.com caught up with former England spinner Monty Panesar, who played 50 Tests and took 167 wickets, for an in-depth chat about Gambhir’s big challenge, India’s new captain Shubman Gill, the team’s prospects in England, Kuldeep Yadav’s potential impact, and more.

title: AI 171 crash probe widens: Ahmedabad airport ground staff quizzed; sabotage angle not ruled out
content: A multi-agency investigation is underway at Ahmedabad's SVPI Airport following the Air India AI 171 crash, which killed 241. Ground handling agencies are under scrutiny, with staff questioned and phones seized. The probe, involving AAIB, Gujarat Police, AAI, DGCA, and the NTSB, seeks to determine the cause, including potential sabotage.

title: Exclusive | 'Why would I come to India if Bangladesh had chess tournaments?': 80-yo Rani Hamid
content: In a captivating encounter at the Delhi International GM Open Chess Tournament 2025, 80-year-old Rani Hamid, a Bangladeshi chess legend, faced 13-year-old prodigy Balaji Sudarshan. Despite a recent string of losses, Hamid's spirit remained undeterred. Sudarshan's skill led to Hamid's defeat, but the two engaged in a post-game analysis, transcending their age gap through their shared passion for chess.

title: UP shocker: Dad performs last rites of ‘daughter’, later finds her alive with ‘lover’
content: A Hamirpur man's grief turned to shock. He identified a body as his missing daughter and performed her last rites. Police later found the daughter alive with her alleged lover. The father had mistakenly identified the body. Now, police are investigating the identity of the deceased woman. They are contacting nearby districts to find missing persons matching her description.

title: IND vs ENG | 1st Test predicted playing XI: Sudharsan or Easwaran
content: IND vs ENG 1st Test predicted playing XI: India’s five-Test tour of England, beginning on June 20 in Leeds, marks the dawn of a new chapter. With stalwarts Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma having retired from Test cricket, a fresh-faced squad under Shubman Gill’s captaincy is ready to prove its mettle in one of the game’s toughest conditions.

title: Woman ‘tortured’ by moneylender allotted 50 cents land in Kuppam
content: Officials give her a cheque for ₹5 lakh sanctioned by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu as financial assistance to support the family

title: Loss of cargo due to sinking of container ship MSC Elsa 3: Kerala HC orders conditional arrest MSC Polo 2 anchored in Vizhinjam port
content: Order based on an admiralty suit filed by a cashew importer firm whose consignment was on board the sunken ship

title: Kerala University institutes inquiry into entrance exam evaluation errors
content: University cancelled a rank list a day ago after major consistencies came to light in evaluation process of entrance examination for four-year undergraduate programmes

title: Centre approves construction of 2.35 lakh houses under PMAY
content: The total houses approved are 2,34,864 for nine States — Assam, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Odisha, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh

title: Wayanad tunnel project gets Union Ministry nod
content: It enables the State government to officially start the construction work of the ₹2,134-crore twin tube unidirectional four-lane tunnel road between Kozhikode and Wayanad districts.  The tendering process has already been completed for the project, which will be implemented by Bhopal-based Dilip Buildcon Limited and Kolkata-based Royal Infrastructure.

title: Man collects 70 tolas of gold jewellery, cash from plane crash site; hands them over to police
content: Rajesh Patel said he collected nearly 70 tolas of gold ornaments, which would be priceless for the victims' kin, ₹50,000 and a few U.S. dollars from the scene of the deadly aviation tragedy and handed them over to the police

title: HRD Minister Lokesh calls on Vice-President, apprises him of NDA government’s achievements in Andhra Pradesh
content: State is poised to be the front-runner in adopting quantum technologies by developing a Quantum Valley in Amaravati, he tells Jagdeep Dhankhar; he also meets Union Ministers Amit Shah, Chirag Paswan and Dharmendra Pradhan

title: ₹2,795 crore spent on guarantee schemes in Dharwad district, says S.R. Patil
content: The Vice-President of the State Level Guarantee Schemes Implementation Authority prioritises delivering the goods to the people

title: Basic data from 2027 Census in three to six months, detailed tables in three to five years; no Census in 2031
content: As the government will still be processing data from the COVID-delayed 2027 Census, it will not be possible to revert to the earlier timeline and hold a Census in 2031, says MoSPI official

title: KAU to host national workshop on agri-start-ups
content: Programme aims at connecting emerging agri-start-ups with key stakeholders in Kerala’s agricultural sector

title: World of reading opens to Kannampadi residents
content: An initiative of Forest department, libraries have been set up at Memari, Kathitheppan, and Kollathikkavu under the Kannampadi tribal settlement in Idukki Wildlife Sanctuary.  The theme of the libraries is ‘Reading is the true addiction’

title: ED has no power to seal a premises if it’s found locked during search operation, ASG concedes before Madras High Court
content: He states that notices pasted on film producer Akash Baskaran’s office premises and his friend’s residence will be withdrawn and all the seized materials would be returned

title: Praveen Togadia calls for nation-wide ban on beef exports
content: The International Working President of the Vishwa Hindu Parishad warns of a decline in Hindu population

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: Meghalaya cops visit accused Sonam's maternal home, question her kin
content: The investigation team arrived at Sonam's maternal house in Govind Nagar Kharcha area of the city. After the police personnel entered the house, its door was shut from inside so that nobody else gained access, eyewitnesses said.

title: 22 more bitten by stray dogs in Kannur, protest erupts at Corporation council meet
content: A day ago, 51 people were bitten, sparking fear among people. Among the injured are elderly people, students, and a differently abled youth.

title: Landslide-hit families living in irreparable houses at Vilangad seek fair deal
content: They allege that there is no progress in addressing the concerns of those whose names were included in the secondary list of beneficiaries

title: Three Maoists killed in exchange of fire in Maredumilli forest of Andhra Pradesh
content: Among the deceased are Central Committee member Uday and South Zonal Committee member Aruna, who carried rewards of ₹25 lakh and ₹20 lakh on their heads respectively

title: Flight carrying 110 students evacuated from Iran to land in New Delhi on Wednesday night
content: Tamheed Mughal, a medical student at the Tehran University told The Hindu that they reached Yerevan, Armenia via land routes on Tuesday (June 17, 2025) and boarded a flight to Doha from there on Wednesday (June 18, 2025) afternoon

title: Andhra Pradesh aims to bring 15,000 hectares under oil palm cultivation in Eluru district
content: The State is aligning its efforts with the vision of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to reduce India’s dependence on imported edible oil, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar

title: Balaramapuram murder: police probing victim’s mother’s involvement
content: While the child’s uncle had initially been arrested in connection with the case, the investigation team now suspects involvement of the mother, following a “revelation” by the accused

title: Air India cancels three international flights due to maintenance, technical and other issues
content: Two of these flights were cancelled after the passengers had already boarded the aircraft, the airline said

title: 2 Killed, 3 Injured After Car Rams Road Divider On Karnataka Highway: Cops
content: Two youths, including a local National Students' Union of India (NSUI) leader, were killed and three others injured when a car they were travelling in rammed a road divider on National Highway 66, near Jeppinamogaru, late Tuesday night.

title: Indian Woman Arrested For Smuggling 1 Kg Gold At Nepal Airport: Cops
content: An Indian woman has been arrested with over one kilogramme of undeclared gold from Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, Nepal police said.

title: Why Father Of Indian Journalist In Iran "Won't Grieve" If His Son Dies There
content: An Indian man working as reporter in the Iranian state TV headquarters in Tehran was providentially saved when Israeli bombs struck the building.

title: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE: 110 Indian Students Evacuated, Khamenei Responds To Trump's 'Surrender' Call
content: Israel-Iran Conflict Day 6 LIVE Updates: The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its sixth day on Wednesday, with both sides widening their attacks.

title: "No Bra, No Entry": Nigeria University Directive Sparks Online Backlash
content: A Nigerian university has ignited an online row after a video showed female staff members touching the breasts of women to check if they were wearing bras before taking part in an exam.

title: 90 Kashmiri Students Among 110 Flown Out From Conflict-Hit Iran By India
content: At least 110 Indian students including 90 from Jammu and Kashmir are set to reach Delhi tonight from conflict-hit Iran after the Union government launched an operation to evacuate them.

title: "Never Too Late To Negotiate": German Minister To Iran On Nuclear Talks
content: Germany's foreign minister appealed to Iran's leaders to make credible assurances that it is not seeking a nuclear weapon and to show it is willing to find a negotiated solution as fears mount of further military escalation between Iran and Israel.

title: "Won't Surrender": Iran Warns US Of 'Irreparable Damage' If It Intervenes
content: After warnings, ultimatums, and even a death threat by Israel's Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump, Iran's Supreme Leader has spoken.

title: "Focus On Studies": Ban On Smartphones In Afghanistan Schools Kicks In
content: A ban on smartphones in schools issued by Taliban authorities in southern Afghanistan came into force, students and teachers confirmed to AFP on Wednesday, over concerns of "focus" and "Islamic law".

title: Gold, Cash, Gita: Builder Helps Families Get Back Crash Victims' Belongings
content: While authorities scoured the debris in Ahmedabad hoping to find survivors after the AI171 plane crash, Raju Patel and his friends launched another operation of their own - one for the recovery of belongings of those who were on site.

title: In Honeymoon Murder Case, 119 Calls By Sonam Raghuvanshi And A New Name
content: A new name has surfaced in the probe into the killing of 29-year-old Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi during his honeymoon in Meghalaya.

title: Explained: What Is Juneteenth, When It Became A US Federal Holiday
content: Juneteenth, a day that marks the emancipation of enslaved Black Americans, is always observed on June 19 each year. It became a U.S. federal holiday in 2021, following the signing of a bill by former President Joe Biden.

title: Guardians Of The Sky - India's Integrated Air Defence That Outfoxed Pakistan
content: India's Integrated Air Command and Control System (IACCS) played a pivotal role in defending the skies. An automated system integrates data from forces to combat aerial threats.

title: Air India Plane Crash: 202 Victims Identified, 124 Bodies Handed Over To Families
content: In a major update on the Ahmedabad plane crash that killed 241 of the 242 onboard, DNA matches have been confirmed for 202 victims, with 157 bodies handed over to families so far.

title: Opinion: Opinion | That Prized American Degree Isn't What It Used To Be
content: Indian parents need to be more circumspect when sending their wards to study overseas in today's turbulent times.

title: Bulldozer Action Averted In Batla House, 44 Of 52 Plots Get Relief
content: Delhi's Batla House, which turned up on the Delhi Development Authority's demolition list recently, has got some temporary relief. Of the 52 plots, 44 have received a freeze order from the court.

title: Cash-Strapped Vatican Unveils Fundraising Video Centred On New Pope
content: The Vatican on Wednesday unveiled a fundraising video centred on newly elected Pope Leo, urging the faithful to support his mission amid a serious financial crisis for the Catholic Church.

title: Timeline: World's Most Expensive Fighter Jet Is Still Grounded In Kerala
content: The British F-35B Lightning II stealth fighter jet, which made an unscheduled landing in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram International Airport on Saturday night, remains grounded for the fourth straight day on Wednesday.

title: Israel-Iran Conflict Intensifies. Here Are The Latest Developments
content: Israel and Iran exchanged fire again on Wednesday, the sixth day of strikes in their most intense confrontation in history, fuelling fears of a drawn-out conflict that could engulf the Middle East.

title: Warnings, Cops Outside Houses: Karnataka Takes Steps For 'Thug Life' Release
content: In the wake of strong observations made by the Supreme Court in favour of allowing the release of 'Thug Life', the Karnataka government has begun tightening enforcement across the state to ensure there are no disruptions.

title: Tomato price crash forces farmers to dump produce
content: Farmers finding it uneconomical to harvest and transport their produce, many not harvesting the crop to save on labour charges; call for cold storage and MSP grows louder

title: National Education Policy objective is to build a knowledge-based society, says expert
content: ICSSR National Fellow Jandhyala B.G. Tilak has said that the core objective is to provide quality education to all sections of society

title: Govt. asks Centre not to give clearances to Banakacharla-Polavaram project of A.P.
content: The project will have adverse impact on the interests of Telangana and its projects, says Minister Uttam Kumar Reddy

title: We have not abandoned lateral entry: Union Minister Jitendra Singh
content: The Centre will bring back lateral entry when there are slots to align with particular skill needs, says Minister; insists that reservation rules cannot be applied to such single post recruitment

title: IMD predicts hot and humid weather in Andhra Pradesh up to June 22
content: There will not be much rainfall activity in the State despite formation of two low pressure systems, it says; many places in the Rayalaseema and South Coastal A.P. regions record a maximum temperature of 40 degree Celsius

title: Eight arrested for hacking VCK functionary to death
content: The main suspect, Suman, had frequent quarrels with the deceased, Kamaraj, in fetching water from a public tap to run his tea shop

title: Man who allegedly ran car over cop’s feet surrenders before court
content: According to the police, he was an accused in multiple cases, including NDPS cases registered by both the police and the Excise department

title: Dredging of canals proposed to curb sea erosion
content: The proposal says silt from dredging canals can be used to reduce the sea depth along the shoreline, thereby weakening the intensity of the marauding waves that wreak havoc in places like Chellanam panchayat during high tide and depression-induced sea incursions

title: 9-year-old boy witnesses father's murder; mother held for plotting with lover in Alwar
content: The incident took place on the night of June 7, when Veeru Jatav, who ran a tent business, was allegedly killed by Kashiram Prajapat, a street vendor and the lover of Veeru's wife, Anita, with the help of hired accomplices.

title: Lack of awareness, limited facilities affect soil testing in Tamil Nadu’s delta region
content: Although both the Union government’s Soil Health Card (SHC) programme and Tamil Nadu’s Tamil Mann Valam portal aim to promote testing, field-level implementation remains inadequate. . The last State-wide mass soil sampling was conducted in 2018–19.

title: Over 50 mango farmers in Vellore booked for blocking road on Tamil Nadu-Andhra border
content: Farmers protested by dumping freshly harvested mangoes on the stretch to highlight the steep fall in mango prices

title: PM Modi arrives in Croatia on last leg of three-nation tour
content: During his visit, PM Modi will hold bilateral talks with Croatian Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic and meet President Zoran Milanovic

title: India has scaled up surveillance, genome sequencing after recent surge in COVID-19: National Institute of Virology
content: The virus isolation of the newer variants will be helpful in assessing vaccine effectiveness, and in supporting India’s indigenous efforts for vaccine development

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Video shows brutal thrashing and stripping of man in Uttar Pradesh’s Balia
content: The video shows a man being asked to strip in a secluded location as two men hold his hands and another man hits him with a stick.

title: Centre asks States to take steps to check high secondary school dropout rates
content: The central government has suggested that the states take special steps to reduce the dropout rate as laid out in the National Education Policy, 2020.

title: Man dies after being hit by Jagan Mohan Reddy’s convoy in Guntur
content: According to police, the accident victim Cheeli Singaiah had come to participate in the rally organised by Jagan Mohan Reddy

title: Indie musician Aksomaniac on his track ‘Kanmashi’ and choosing music as a career
content: The 22-year-old independent artiste from Thiruvananthapuram on his new track espouses fluidity, dealing with self-love and self-exploration

title: Thermal imaging drones deployed at Gudalur forest division of Nilgiris to monitor elephants
content: The forest department said the initiative to use drones has been taken to minimise the number of negative human-elephant interactions in the region.

title: Air India plane crash: Insurers in a fix as both policyholders and nominees among dead
content: The task becomes difficult when both the insured individual and the nominee die, as in the case of air accidents, representatives of the insurance firms maintained.

title: Andhra Pradesh Minister Nara Lokesh seeks Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar’s support for State development
content: Asked about the progress of construction of the capital Amaravati, Nara Lokesh told Jagdeep Dhankhar that works costing about ₹64,000 crore were going on in different stages at a brisk pace

title: Israel-Iran conflict leaves Karnataka village anxious over safety of loved ones stuck in war zone
content: The residents of Alipur had travelled to Iran for various reasons, including pursuing Islamic theological studies, medical education, pilgrimage, and business activities

title: Calcutta HC directs Centre to implement MGNREGA scheme in West Bengal from August 1
content: Calcutta High Court said the Centre is empowered to impose special conditions, restrictions and regulations, which have not been imposed in other States of the country

title: Former Andhra CM Jagan organises rally from Tadepalli to Sattenapalli to meet family members of deceased YSRCP worker in Palnadu district

title: No 'compulsion' to learn Hindi as third language: Devendra Fadnavis on row over Maharashtra Government Order
content: While English is widely promoted, Indian languages are often neglected, Devendra Fadnavis told reporters in Dehu and maintained that disputes over languages are unnecessary.

title: Kannamaly highway siege in Kerala over sea incursion called off after three days following talks
content: Deputy Collectors of disaster management and revenue recovery, the Kochi tahsildar and the major Irrigation department executive engineer participated in the talks

title: Ahmedabad plane crash survivor discharged from hospital, attends brother's cremation in Diu
content: The mortal remains of Vishwas Kumar Ramesh’s brother, Ajay, were handed over to the family in the early hours of June 18 after a DNA test confirmed his identity

title: Allahabad HC stays passing final judgment in eviction case against Azam Khan
content: Allahabad High Court stays final judgment in 2016 eviction case involving ex-MP Azam Khan until July 3, 2025

title: Bombay High Court dismisses BCCI’s petition against Kochi Tuskers

title: Karnataka’s proposed 10-hour work shifts: What you need to know
content: The draft amendment to the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishment Act, 1961, seeks to increase work hours to 10 hours a day and 48 hours a week.

title: Karnataka rains: Outflow from Kabini reservoir increased to 25,000 cusecs, flood warning issued

title: SC grants interim bail to Kerala journalist T.P. Nandakumar booked for defamatory YouTube video against politician

title: Keeladi excavation report of archaeologist Amarnath Ramakrishna: Why are Centre and T.N. government at loggerheads?
content: Keeladi (also spelt Keezhadi), located about 12 km southeast of Madurai, drew national attention after over 7,500 ancient artifacts believed to be from Sangam Age were unearthed. In 2014, Amarnath Ramakrishna, then the ASI’s Superintending Archaeologist, initiated excavations at the site, which was originally a coconut grove.

title: FASTag annual pass for private vehicles to be launched on August 15: Nitin Gadkari
content: The pass will be valid for one year from the date of activation or up to 200 trips, whichever comes first

title: Shaquille O'Neal to join WWE 2K25 roster with Tyrese Haliburton
content: The next DLC pack for WWE 2K25 is just over a week away, and the second of the mystery NBA stars being added to the game has been revealed. Shaquille O'Neal will join  Tyrese Haliburton  in the "Dunk & Destruction Pack." Shaq has had a lot of involvement in the pro-wrestling world over the years. Back in 2016, he was a surprise competitor at WrestleMania 32's Andre the Giant Memorial Battle Royal, where his massive 7-foot-1 frame stood up to the equally huge Big Show. Then in 2021, Shaq turned to AEW, competing in a tag team match with the then-debuting Jade Cargill against company founder Cody Rhodes and Red Velvet. Alongside Shaq, Haliburton and the one NBA star yet to be announced, this DLC pack features The Great Khali, a former world champion in WWE, and Abyss, a former TNA wrestler who now works as a backstage producer for WWE. It is scheduled to release on June 25, 2025.
